trans-unit.source: Finalize your recovered Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Finalize your recovered Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Point in Time Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal

trans-unit.source: This article provides a checklist of tasks that you need to go through before putting a newly recovered Azure SQL Database back into production.
trans-unit.target: This article provides a checklist of tasks that you need to go through before putting a newly recovered Azure SQL Database back into production.

trans-unit.source: This checklist applies to databases recovered from Geo-Replication failover, Deleted Database Restore, Point-in-Time Restore, or Geo-Restore.
trans-unit.target: This checklist applies to databases recovered from Geo-Replication failover, Deleted Database Restore, Point-in-Time Restore, or Geo-Restore.

trans-unit.source: Verify connection strings of your application are pointing to the newly recovered database.
trans-unit.target: Verify connection strings of your application are pointing to the newly recovered database.

trans-unit.source: Update your connection strings if one of the below situations applies:
trans-unit.target: Update your connection strings if one of the below situations applies:

trans-unit.source: The recovered database uses a different name from the source database name
trans-unit.target: The recovered database uses a different name from the source database name

trans-unit.source: The recovered database is on a different server from the source server
trans-unit.target: The recovered database is on a different server from the source server

trans-unit.source: For more information about changing connection strings, see <linkText>Guidelines for Connecting to Azure SQL Database Programmatically</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Connections to Azure SQL Database: Central Recommendations </linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about changing connection strings, see <linkText>Guidelines for Connecting to Azure SQL Database Programmatically</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Connections to Azure SQL Database: Central Recommendations </linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Verify the firewall rules at server-level and database-level, and make sure connections from your client computers or Azure to the server and the newly recovered database are enabled.
trans-unit.target: Verify the firewall rules at server-level and database-level, and make sure connections from your client computers or Azure to the server and the newly recovered database are enabled.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Firewall</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to: Configure Firewall Settings (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Verify if all the logins used by your application exist on the server which is hosting your recovered database.
trans-unit.target: Verify if all the logins used by your application exist on the server which is hosting your recovered database.

trans-unit.source: Re-create the missing logins and grant them appropriate permissions on the recovered database.
trans-unit.target: Re-create the missing logins and grant them appropriate permissions on the recovered database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Managing Databases and Logins in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Managing Databases and Logins in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Verify if each database users in the recovered database is associated with a valid server login.
trans-unit.target: Verify if each database users in the recovered database is associated with a valid server login.

trans-unit.source: Use ALTER USER statement to map user to valid server login.
trans-unit.target: Use ALTER USER statement to map user to valid server login.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>ALTER USER</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>ALTER USER</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Verify if your existing alert rule settings are map to your recovered database.
trans-unit.target: Verify if your existing alert rule settings are map to your recovered database.

trans-unit.source: Update the setting if one of below situations applies:
trans-unit.target: Update the setting if one of below situations applies:

trans-unit.source: The recovered database uses a different name from the source database name
trans-unit.target: The recovered database uses a different name from the source database name

trans-unit.source: The recovered database is on a different server from the source server
trans-unit.target: The recovered database is on a different server from the source server

trans-unit.source: For more information about database alert rules, see <linkText>How to: Receive Alert Notifications and Manage Alert Rules in Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about database alert rules, see <linkText>How to: Receive Alert Notifications and Manage Alert Rules in Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If auditing is required to access your database, you need to enable Auditing after the database recovery.
trans-unit.target: If auditing is required to access your database, you need to enable Auditing after the database recovery.

trans-unit.source: A good indicator of auditing is required is that client applications use secure connection strings in a pattern of *.database.secure.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: A good indicator of auditing is required is that client applications use secure connection strings in a pattern of *.database.secure.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with SQL database auditing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with SQL database auditing</linkText><title></title>.
